item.title: Ariana Grande Expands North American ‘Eternal Sunshine’ Tour
item.description: Ariana Grande has added nine dates to the North American leg of her 2026 “Eternal Sunshine” tour. The newly added shows are scattered across the United States and Canada, with extra dates

item.title: MTV VMAs 2025: Lady Gaga, Ariana Grande Take Top Prizes; Sabrina Carpenter, Mariah Carey Shine on Stage
item.description: Gaga won four awards, including artist of the year, while Grande won video of the year for “brighter days ahead.”

item.title: Ariana Grande Wins Video of the Year at 2025 MTV VMAs: “I Promise There Are ‘Brighter Days Ahead'”
item.description: The Grammy winner also won best pop artist and said: “Thank you to my therapists and gay people, I love you!”

item.title: Mariah Carey Receives First VMA With Video Vanguard Award: “What in the Sam Hill Took You So Long?!”
item.description: The superstar singer, known for her five-octave range, was honored by Ariana Grande and delivered a medley of hits, with her “Heartbreaker” alter ego Bianca making an appearance onstage.

item.title: Ariana Grande Announces 2026 Tour
item.description: The Eternal Sunshine tour, which marks her first in seven years, kicks off in Oakland, Calf., on June 6, 2026.
